IRS Code 460 Meaning

IRS Code 460 records an approved extension of time to file. On a transcript, it helps you determine whether a return was timely under extension and how to separate late-filing exposure from late-payment exposure.

Try the parser (requires credits)

Plain-English definition

IRS Code 460 typically indicates the IRS recorded an approved extension of time to file the return for the tax period. It gives you an extension deadline to compare against the eventual filing/assessment entry.

When does Code 460 appear?

Code 460 usually posts before the return is filed and assessed. You will often see it dated around the original due date, reflecting when the IRS recorded the extension.

Compare the Code 460 date to:

  • The transaction date on Code 150 (Return filed & tax assessed).
  • Any notice entries such as Code 971.
  • Payments and credits like Code 806 (withholding credit).

What does Code 460 usually signal?

Timely filing under extension

If Code 150 posts on or before the extended deadline reflected by Code 460, the return is generally timely filed under extension.

Late filing even with an extension on file

If Code 150 is dated after the extension deadline, the return is late even though an extension existed. That timing difference matters for late-filing penalty analysis and any reasonable-cause story.

Extension to file is not extension to pay

Code 460 affects late-filing exposure, but does not stop late-payment penalties and interest. Tax is still due by the original deadline.

What should a tax professional do next?

  • Capture the extension deadline. Record the Code 460 date in your workpapers.
  • Validate filing timing. Compare Code 150’s date against the extension date.
  • Separate filing vs. payment issues. Model late-filing separately from late-payment/interest.
  • Document the timeline. Put the dates into a client-facing transcript report so your conclusions are auditable.

Example code block

Transcript timeline excerpt
460  Extension of time to file (approved)     10-15-2024
150  Return filed & tax assessed              10-14-2024
971  Notice issued                             11-04-2024

FAQ: IRS Code 460

What does IRS Code 460 mean on my client's transcript?

It indicates the IRS recorded an approved extension of time to file for that period.

Does Code 460 stop late-payment penalties and interest?

No. It extends time to file, not time to pay. Payment is still due by the original deadline.

How do I tell if the return was filed within the extended deadline?

Compare Code 460’s date to Code 150’s transaction date. If Code 150 is on/before the extension date, it is generally timely under extension.

What should I document for my workpapers when I see Code 460?

Record the extension date, the filing/assessment date, and how those dates affect late-filing vs late-payment analysis.
